title: Andy Cole despairs at demise of former clubs Man Utd and Newcastle
text:

Andy Cole has admitted it is 'frustrating' and 'disappointing' to witness the demise of his former clubs Man Utd and Newcastle .

The retired striker was a prolific goalscorer for both sides during his playing days, and achieved great success with the Red Devils.

Cole was part of Man Utd's 1999 treble-winning side under Sir Alex Ferguson, having made made the switch from Tyneside four years earlier when Newcastle were a top six side.

But fortunes have since changed dramatically for both clubs, and Cole has revealed his torment at seeing the plight of his old clubs.

“It’s difficult, really difficult," Cole told the Sun . "My time with Manchester United was so successful so when you see your team struggling like it is, you do ask yourself questions, and naturally punters will ask you questions as well.

(Image: REUTERS)

“It gets frustrating because you want the current team to be playing well and winning the Premier League just like we did."

United are currently 10th in the table having won just two of their opening seven league matches.

Newcastle meanwhile are one from bottom after their recent 5-0 thrashing at the hands of Leicester .

Cole added: "If you look at Newcastle now, they are more than happy if they finish in the top half. That’s how much things have changed. I do get a little bit disappointed because all Newcastle fans want is just a little bit of success.”

(Image: PA)

The two sides square off against each other at St James' Park on Sunday in a clash that neither can afford to lose.

And there will be little respite after the international break, with Newcastle following that up with a trip to Chelsea , while United host league leaders Liverpool .

Cole has urged United frontman Marcus Rashford to get on the scoresheet and start contributing more goals if he is to be the main striker at the club.

He said: "If you are going to play as a centre forward for Manchester United , you have got to be looking to get yourself 20 goals.

“His best return in a season so far is 13 and if that is your best return, and you are the main striker, you are going to have to get yourself a few more.”
description: The former England striker played for both clubs with great success during his illustrious career
